prompt.p: A 54-year-old woman presents to her GP complaining of a sore throat and generally feeling unwell. She has had sweats and chills over the last 48 h. On examination there is erythema of the pharynx and cervical lymphadenopathy. Haematological investigation:
What medication is the cause of the patient's presentation?

modalFeedback.p: Option B (Carbimazole) is Correct. Agranulocytosis is a complication of this medication used to treat hyperthyroidism. Patients are warned to seek medical attention if they become ill with symptoms and sign of infection.
Options A (Alendronate) is Incorrect. Alendronate is a bisphosphonate that is used in osteoporosis. Tablets can cause erosion of the gastrointestinal tract, e.g. oesophagitis or gastric ulceration.
Option C (Metformin) is Incorrect. Metformin can rarely cause lactic acidosis which requires withdrawal of this treatment.
Option D (Prednisolone) is Incorrect. Prednisolone can cause iatrogenic Cushing's syndrome.
Option E (Thyroxine) is Incorrect. Levothyroxine can cause symptoms and signs of thyrotoxicosis.
